intro: Haloragis leptotheca, commonly known as the slender-leaved waterwheel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wetland habitats, such as marshes and along the edges of water bodies. The plant features small, green, oval-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stems. Its flowers are tiny, clustered in whorls, and are usually pink or red in color. It plays an important ecological role in its native environment by providing habitat and food for various invertebrates.
